pronunciation: CONTEMN, [Latin , to despise; to drive away.]

definitions.text:
1. To consider and treat as mean and despicable; scorn.In whose eyes vile person contemned. Psalms 15:4.
2. To slight; neglect as unworthy of regard; reject with disdain.Wherefore do the wicked contemn God. Psalms 10:13.They contemn the counsel of the Most High. Psalms 107:11.
